IntroductionÂ¶

distro is an implementation of the BOINC Client in JavaScript.

BOINC (Berkeley Open Infrastructure for Network Computing). is an open-source software for computing using volunteered resources.

Currently, the BOINC client works like this: 1. The client fetches new jobs from a scheduling server. 2. The client runs the jobs (e.g. checking if a number is prime). 3. The client sends the results back to the server for evaluation.

distro does all this, but without the need to install the BOINC client. distro runs on your browser. Whenever you visit a site with distro, it will use your computer to do computation in the background.

This project is done by two Ngee Ann Polytechnic students, Joel Tio and Sean Nicholas.
